channel.title: Comments on: Software preview MySQL Scriptable Replication
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: Robert Hodges
item.dc:creator: Robert Hodges
item.description:
Hi,
This is an interesting feature. We have put a lot of effort into SQL filtering in Tungsten (http://www.continuent.com/community), which I invite interested readers to try.
Does scriptable replication allow you to change events? For many problems, that's an important capability. Also, how does Lua deal with binary or embedded charsets using introducers like _binary? That's a pretty nasty feature if you are parsing statements. Tungsten deals with this now but it was not easy. (I finished the implementation a few weeks ago and it is posting this week as part of version 1.2.1.)
Cheers, Robert

item.title: By: Henrik Ingo
item.dc:creator: Henrik Ingo
item.description:
Hi Andrew
Cool feature, I can see this becoming popular. At Monty Program we have been planning some work that would make RBR replication more human readable and thus more easily filtered too.
Anyway, since this is purely STMT based replication for now, it seems it is not applicable to MySQL Cluster. In fact, surprising to see you cover this!

item.title: By: Mats Kindahl
item.dc:creator: Mats Kindahl
item.description:
You can probably optimize the matching pattern to create the shorter function:
function after_read(event) local m = event.query if m then id = string.match(m, "sub_id *= *(%d+)") if id then if id %2 == 1 then return true else return false end else return false end else return false end end
item.content:encoded:
You can probably optimize the matching pattern to create the shorter function:

function after_read(event)
local m = event.query
if m then
id = string.match(m, “sub_id *= *(%d+)”)
if id then
if id %2 == 1 then
return true
else
return false
end
else
return false
end
else
return false
end
end
